primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Zacchaeus seeks to see Jesus, performs acts of reparation and charity, and thereby earns/merits the status of a 'son of Abraham' and salvation.

subject.identificatie: Zacchaeus (as a proxy for the Hearer)
tekstueel_bewijs: He wanted to contemplate the features
Zacchaeus was offering everything he possessed

object.identificatie: Salvation / The title of 'Son of Abraham' / Divine Approval

zender.identificatie: The Divine Law / The Judgment Seat of Christ
tekstueel_bewijs: appearing before the judgment seat of Christ
the glory promised for works of mercy

ontvanger.identificatie: Zacchaeus (and the Hearer who imitates him)
tekstueel_bewijs: you’ll be entitled to the same reward as Zacchaeus
to compensate for being so short
merited this blessing by climbing up the sycamore tree
helper.rol_van_god: God is largely the Object to be attained or the Judge who reacts to the Subject's initiative.

tegenstander.identificatie: Short stature / Shame of the Cross / Fraudulent past
tekstueel_bewijs: being so short he wouldn’t see the Savior
didn’t fear the shame associated with the cross
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The obstacles are primarily physical (height) or social (shame/fraud), which can be overcome by human effort (climbing/repaying).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Hearer's imitation of Zacchaeus to achieve the same reward.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer ('Dear brothers')
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The biblical story serves as a 'competence-building' template for the hearer to execute the same program.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Divine Justice → Salvation → The Imitating Hearer
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Works of Mercy → Hearer ← Moral Shortcomings

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon assumes the hearer already has the 'Pouvoir' (power) and 'Savoir' (knowledge); it focuses on 'Vouloir' (motivation) to trigger the 'Devoir' (obligation).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved through human 'reparation' which satisfies the 'judgment seat'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; sin is viewed as 'fraud' that can be 'paid back four times as much'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon mentions 'grace' and 'blood of Christ', the underlying actantial engine is purely synergetic/meritocratic. Salvation is a 'reward' for 'excellent attitude' and 'reparation'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: you merited this blessing by climbing up the sycamore tree
How can you flatter yourself with the title of 'son' when you don’t prove sonship by your faith... or your works?

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: he himself was being looked at even more searchingly by the Savior

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Zacchaeus is explicitly presented as a 'model' to be imitated to achieve the same results.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on Jesus as the one who seeks and saves the lost (the 'Son of Man' as Subject), regardless of their ability to climb trees or pay back debts.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform; anxiety regarding whether one's 'works' authenticate their 'nature'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Pelagianism; salvation as a wage for labor.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is very coherent in its moralism; the secondary program (ethics) is perfectly fused with the primary program (soteriology).
spanning_punten: The mention of 'justified by the blood of Christ' clashes with the claim that he 'merited this blessing by climbing'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: he’d receive a more favorable verdict, be forgiven his sins of injustice, and reap the glory promised for works of mercy

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The human 'will' is treated as naturally capable once 'enabled' by a generic divine generosity.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a debt (fraud) that can be balanced by a larger credit (reparation/mercy).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'manual for merit'. Zacchaeus is the hero, and Jesus is the prize awarded for the hero's effort.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: Zacchaeus/Hearer is the subject of 'meriting', 'climbing', and 'offering'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Jesus the Subject of 'seeking', 'calling', and 'transforming'.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'You merited this blessing by climbing', use 'Jesus stopped under the tree to claim a lost son who could never climb high enough to reach God.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Hero' who must perform.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Receiver' who is found.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize Zacchaeus's lostness and Jesus's 'must' (divine necessity) to save.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (Grace as the power given to the unable).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how Jesus's presence *creates* the generosity in Zacchaeus, rather than Zacchaeus's generosity *buying* Jesus's presence.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Sin as a dead-end; the impossibility of a tax collector ever 'repaying' the spiritual debt.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To make Grace necessary rather than just a 'favorable verdict' for a good effort.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (giving to poor) is the cause of Soteriology (salvation).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Jesus saves Zacchaeus) → Ethics (Zacchaeus joyfully gives).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a strong narrative flow but requires a radical 'Subject-switch' to ensure the Gospel is about what Christ has done rather than what we must do to merit Him.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is persuasive and encouraging; actantially, it is legalistic.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical role of tax collectors; Greimas reveals the 'merit-engine' driving the application.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Son of Abraham' is treated as a 'commodity' to be earned rather than a gift of lineage.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the word 'grace' once, but immediately subordinates it to the human 'will' (Zacchaeus deserved the name by the grace of God because his will was conformed).
